title.narrative: SERVICES AND PARENTING PROGRAMMES AT LOCAL LEVEL

description.narrative: Children and their families benefit from parenting services and programmes as part of integrated early childhood development services at the local level, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Early Childhood Development, Evaluation And Research, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, particularly those in situations of disadvantage, benefit from coordinated policies and programmes, have increased access to integrated social services, and have their rights increasingly monitored.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and their families benefit from parenting services and programmes as part of integrated early childhood developmentservices at the local level

description.narrative: UNICEF continued supporting the Government to improve the quality of parenting programmes providing emphasis in policies related to child nutritional and mental health. UNICEF supported the comprehensive development of children, parent co-responsibility and violence against children, advocating for the strengthening ofChile Grows with Youand supporting schools to prevent COVID-19 transmission through different strategies and mechanisms in the education community. UNICEF also generated evidence regarding the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on children&39;s health in order to define the most effective actions that should be taken in 2022. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: Early learning policy and early learning programme ensuring parents and communities involvement.(55269)

baseline.value: There is no parenting programmes and services as an integrate policy that ensure ECD at the local level.

target.value: 2022:There is a coordinated parenting programmes and services with a common framework that ensure ECD at the local level.
